text:
Bryant Park: The fountain in the western portion as overshadowed by the huge 500 Fifth Avenue Building. Adjacent to same is the secondary Salmon Tower with the still lower (former) Aeolian Hall. To the right and forming the Fifth Avenue frontage is the New York Public Library.

August 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Bryant Park

text:
General View Midtown Manhattan, in the 40's: View 1 is northwestward toward the 42nd Street group of skyscrapers, seen from 34th Street and Second Avenue. From right to left are the Chanin, Lincoln, Lefcourt-National, 500 Fifth Avenue, and 10 East 40th Street Buildings.

View 2 is west on 42nd Street from the Chanin Building. On the left is the Lincoln Building and on the right the 500 Fifth Avenue Building.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: October 13, 1939
View 2: July 2, 1940
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - West 40s.
